TextSection.Contents: A rare benign renal tumor characterized by a typically unilateral solitary multiloculated cystic mass consisting of small non-communicating cysts with flat cuboidal or hobnail epithelial lining separated by fibrous septa which may have an ovarian stroma-like appearance or be paucicellular. The tumor is surrounded by a thick fibrous capsule and does not contain solid areas or necrosis. Patients may be asymptomatic or present with a palpable abdominal mass and/or abdominal or flank pain. Age distribution is bimodal the typical age of onset being either below five or between 40 and 70 years of age.

Parent.Label: Rare disorder potentially indicated for kidney transplant
